title: How to Beat Elden Ring in Under 5 Minutes | Speed Break
description: Elden Ring Speedrunner Mitchriz joined Dave Klein (DaveControl) to breakdown some of the ways speed runners break Elden Ring in order to achieve their world record times.

title: Firearms Expert Reacts To Starship Troopers: Extermination’s Guns
description: Jonathan Ferguson, a weapons expert and Keeper of Firearms & Artillery at the Royal Armouries, breaks down more of the weaponry of Starship Troopers: Extermination, including the film’s iconic Morita MK1 assault rifle, the E-Pulse firearms, and the Morita Hawkeye.

title: One Piece Anime to Take a Six-Month Hiatus, Remastered Fish-Man Island Saga to Take Its Place
description: Toei Animation has announced that the One Piece anime will be taking a six-month hiatus starting today, October 13, and that it will return with new episodes from the Egghead arc in April 2025. In its place, fans will be able to look forward to a remastered version of One Piece's Fish-Man Island Saga and a special 25th anniversary episode.
author: Adam Bankhurst

title: Sony Warned 2024 Would Be Light But PS5 Still Has The Best Games

title: Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred Is An Expansion Worth Committing To
description: With the release of Vessel of Hatred, Diablo IV has seen its most significant changes since its original launch in June 2023. Adding a completely new region, Nahantu, along with a wealth of added characters and modes and a brand-new story, the expansion pack is the very definition of a game changer. But it goes even…Read more...
author: John Walker

title: This Might Be The Biggest Hack In Pokémon History
description: Pokémon maker Game Freak has suffered a massive data breach that saw employee info as well as tons of details about past games and upcoming sequels stolen from the developer. Fans are calling the leaked data the “Teraleak” as insider accounts pore over everything from unused Pokémon designs to the codename for the…Read more...

description: Last week, we asked you to venture into spooky gaming settings and share hair-raising locations using #PSshare #PSBlog. title: Terrifier 3’s goriest scene owes Psycho, Scarface, and Passion of the Christ a debt
description: Don’t get too attached to any characters in Terrifier 3, the latest movie in Damien Leone’s viral-hit splatter series about evil murder-mime Art the Clown. This installment features a clearer sense of what series mainstay Art the Clown actually is, plus more narrative, more background lore, and more character work, particularly with previous survivors Sienna […]
author: Tasha Robinson

title: The movies that inspired the Silent Hill series and where to watch them
description: Earlier this week, Silent Hill 2 finally emerged from the fog of its development. A remake of the original 2001 game of the same name by Polish developer Bloober Team (Layers of Fear, The Medium), Silent Hill 2 is easily the most anticipated and ambitious horror game of 2024, a modern take on one of […]
author: Toussaint Egan

title: What’s on your bookshelf: Remedy Entertainment, Bioshock 2, and Gone Home’s Johnnemann Nordhagen
description: Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! I need to start getting a ‘Gene Wolfe referenced’ reaction image for these things, I swear - although this reference is at least hidden behind a couple of links. Which links? That’d be spoiling the layered environmental storytelling that keeps you coming back. This week, it’s Senior Technical Narrative Designer at Remedy, previously of Fullbright, Bioshock 2, and Where The Water Tastes Like Wine fame, Johnnemann Nordhagen! Cheers Johnnemann! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf? Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: There's a future where you and this bucket that fits over your head decide what a game meant to say, not the useless idiots that made it
description: It's not far away, you know. The promised land of never having to experience a game the way it was intended again. That long sought after holy grail of sticking your fingers in your ears and going wahwahwah. But it’s not going to be something created by people with talent, vision, expertise, drive, a dream, or a story in their hearts. No, as with everything in our imminent future, it will be achieved by putting a bucket over your head. Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: Notes from the First Week of the Great Tenerifis Migration
description: Has it only been a week since the move from Delve to Tenerifis and other points east was announced and kicked off?  How are we not there already?  It’s not like we’re moving everything we own… wait… that is exactly what we’re doing. Anyway, I have spent a week fretting and trying to get ready, […]

title: Life Lately: Candy Yum Yum | Breakfast Cheese and Fruit | Lipstick Challenge for Next Week?
description: Hey, hey Saturday! I’m still around, and I’m still alive, and I’m still wearing Candy Yum Yum lipstick by MAC! I found it last week while I was rooting around inside a makeup drawer and decided that even though it’s fall, hot pink is still wildly appropriate for the season, ha ha ha! I’m just realizing right now that I’ve yet to wear any dark, rich and cozy wine, burgundy, brown, garnet or red fall lip colors, hmm. In fact, my lipstick game has been pretty MIA for a while now. Still, I gotta give props to myself and to all the makeup lovers out there who are doing a decent job filling in brows, curling lashes and basically doing the bare minimum to look somewhat undead. LOL! It’s funny to me that I haven’t really been wearing anything on my lips because lipstick and gloss are usually my favorite part of the makeup process. Lately, I’ll paint on some base and blush and whatever else I have time for in the mornings, and by[Continue reading...] The post Life Lately: Candy Yum Yum | Breakfast Cheese and Fruit | Lipstick Challenge for Next Week? appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 851
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Last person who complimented you on your makeup? My coworker last week. I was wearing a little more coverage than usual, so I think the overall look was more polished than the bare bones FOTDs I’ve been wearing for months now. Amazing what a difference a little bit of concealer makes! 2. Last dream you can remember? Marnie and I were like the Scooby Doo detectives in our neighborhood, ha ha ha! We were working a case to unveil who had stolen all the tuna sandwiches in our circle. 3. Today the temperature in my neighborhood is/was ____. The Bay Area is experiencing a heat wave, ugh! It’s supposed to hit 94. I’m so over it. 4. Your cookie of choice? Lately I’ve been obsessed with snickerdoodles.[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 851 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
